trans-unit.source: Open Publishing Introduction
trans-unit.target: Open Publishing Introduction

trans-unit.source: Open Publishing (OP) is a modern content authoring and publish workflow based on markdown and Git.
trans-unit.target: Open Publishing (OP) is a modern content authoring and publish workflow based on markdown and Git.

trans-unit.source: It is built as a set of content services accessible through open standard-based interfaces such as Git.
trans-unit.target: It is built as a set of content services accessible through open standard-based interfaces such as Git.

trans-unit.source: Easy to author:
trans-unit.target: Easy to author:

trans-unit.source: Markdown as authoring language
trans-unit.target: Markdown as authoring language

trans-unit.source: Validate and preview your changes locally just as you write the code
trans-unit.target: Validate and preview your changes locally just as you write the code

trans-unit.source: Easy to publish:
trans-unit.target: Easy to publish:

trans-unit.source: Push your content to Git and wait it to be published automatically
trans-unit.target: Push your content to Git and wait it to be published automatically

trans-unit.source: Open to multiple endpoint support
trans-unit.target: Open to multiple endpoint support

trans-unit.source: Easy to collaborate:
trans-unit.target: Easy to collaborate:

trans-unit.source: Use Git (GitHub/VSO) as collaboration interface
trans-unit.target: Use Git (GitHub/VSO) as collaboration interface

trans-unit.source: Contribute/review/comment using pull request
trans-unit.target: Contribute/review/comment using pull request

trans-unit.source: You can see a demo on Open Publishing <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: You can see a demo on Open Publishing <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open Publishing is being developed by the Visual Studio China team.
trans-unit.target: Open Publishing is being developed by the Visual Studio China team.

trans-unit.source: The team owns the MSDN and Technet platforms, as well as other tools related to content authoring and publishing.
trans-unit.target: The team owns the MSDN and Technet platforms, as well as other tools related to content authoring and publishing.

trans-unit.source: 1. Why Open Publishing?
trans-unit.target: 1. Why Open Publishing?

trans-unit.source: Our legacy documentation processes and tools are not designed for services that are easily consumable by a variety of customers with unique and individual needs.
trans-unit.target: Our legacy documentation processes and tools are not designed for services that are easily consumable by a variety of customers with unique and individual needs.

trans-unit.source: This presents itself in several ways:
trans-unit.target: This presents itself in several ways:

trans-unit.source: Document releases are moving from years/months releases to weeks/days/several times a day
trans-unit.target: Document releases are moving from years/months releases to weeks/days/several times a day

trans-unit.source: Technical documentation is shifting from large size to small, hierarchical to flat, from static to interactive
trans-unit.target: Technical documentation is shifting from large size to small, hierarchical to flat, from static to interactive

trans-unit.source: Product/Engineering teams and external communities need to directly contribute to content creation/feedback
trans-unit.target: Product/Engineering teams and external communities need to directly contribute to content creation/feedback

trans-unit.source: Product/Engineering teams prefer to use the same process for code and docs
trans-unit.target: Product/Engineering teams prefer to use the same process for code and docs

trans-unit.source: Product/Engineering teams are increasingly hosting more docs on their own websites
trans-unit.target: Product/Engineering teams are increasingly hosting more docs on their own websites

trans-unit.source: Without common tools, many teams are building their own tools, sites, etc. This means a lot of fragmentation in processes, tools and environments, which affects productivity and customer experience.
trans-unit.target: Without common tools, many teams are building their own tools, sites, etc. This means a lot of fragmentation in processes, tools and environments, which affects productivity and customer experience.

trans-unit.source: Although different teams may have different workflows, many content publishing scenarios and requirements are the same.
trans-unit.target: Although different teams may have different workflows, many content publishing scenarios and requirements are the same.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Commonality</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Commonality</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Thus, if we can open up the content pipeline piece by piece, teams can use those essential common blocks.
trans-unit.target: Thus, if we can open up the content pipeline piece by piece, teams can use those essential common blocks.

trans-unit.source: We will accomplish this by providing services via Open Publishing.
trans-unit.target: We will accomplish this by providing services via Open Publishing.

trans-unit.source: Key benefits:
trans-unit.target: Key benefits:

trans-unit.source: Decoupling of content creation and distribution
trans-unit.target: Decoupling of content creation and distribution

trans-unit.source: Continuous integration
trans-unit.target: Continuous integration

trans-unit.source: Open contribution and connected feedback
trans-unit.target: Open contribution and connected feedback

trans-unit.source: Flexible hosting
trans-unit.target: Flexible hosting

trans-unit.source: Centralized analytics
trans-unit.target: Centralized analytics

trans-unit.source: There would be four core services in Open Publishing
trans-unit.target: There would be four core services in Open Publishing

trans-unit.source: Reference content auto-generation
trans-unit.target: Reference content auto-generation

trans-unit.source: Content publishing
trans-unit.target: Content publishing

trans-unit.source: Localization
trans-unit.target: Localization

trans-unit.source: BI
trans-unit.target: BI

trans-unit.source: In the future, Open Publishing service would be open sourced to any team in Microsoft, to allow other them to contribute to the codebase and build even more customized solutions.
trans-unit.target: In the future, Open Publishing service would be open sourced to any team in Microsoft, to allow other them to contribute to the codebase and build even more customized solutions.

trans-unit.source: 2. Major Scenarios
trans-unit.target: 2. Major Scenarios

trans-unit.source: Open Publishing will be created and deployed in Phases. For a up-to-date list of current and future work, please visit <linkText>TFS feature request list</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Open Publishing will be created and deployed in Phases. For a up-to-date list of current and future work, please visit <linkText>TFS feature request list</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following are the key scenarios that Open Publishing will cover:
trans-unit.target: The following are the key scenarios that Open Publishing will cover:

trans-unit.source: Standardized interface and agile tooling
trans-unit.target: Standardized interface and agile tooling

trans-unit.source: Git and Markdown (as well as HTML) are commonly accepted interface and format both internally and externally
trans-unit.target: Git and Markdown (as well as HTML) are commonly accepted interface and format both internally and externally

trans-unit.source: Plenty of additional tools available for different teams to choose according to their existing process and usage
trans-unit.target: Plenty of additional tools available for different teams to choose according to their existing process and usage

trans-unit.source: Available and accessible for all
trans-unit.target: Available and accessible for all

trans-unit.source: Internally - product teams as well as content teams
trans-unit.target: Internally - product teams as well as content teams

trans-unit.source: Externally - open to Microsoft customers for contribution
trans-unit.target: Externally - open to Microsoft customers for contribution

trans-unit.source: Different types of documentation
trans-unit.target: Different types of documentation

trans-unit.source: Conceptual content for getting started, tutorials, etc.
trans-unit.target: Conceptual content for getting started, tutorials, etc.

trans-unit.source: Reference content for API
trans-unit.target: Reference content for API

trans-unit.source: Accepting content authored from multiple tool chains, such as
trans-unit.target: Accepting content authored from multiple tool chains, such as

trans-unit.source: Rich Content Management systems like CAPS (Content Authoring and Publishing Services) used by teams who like a rich experience to author, localize, and publish content.
trans-unit.target: Rich Content Management systems like CAPS (Content Authoring and Publishing Services) used by teams who like a rich experience to author, localize, and publish content.

trans-unit.source: Git repos, including GitHub and VSO
trans-unit.target: Git repos, including GitHub and VSO

trans-unit.source: Multiple hosting environments
trans-unit.target: Multiple hosting environments

trans-unit.source: MSDN, TechNet, VisualStudio.com
trans-unit.target: MSDN, TechNet, VisualStudio.com

trans-unit.source: Custom domain support
trans-unit.target: Custom domain support

trans-unit.source: Content management as a service
trans-unit.target: Content management as a service

trans-unit.source: Self-managed, flexible content workflow: from provisioning, authoring, staging and reviewing to publishing
trans-unit.target: Self-managed, flexible content workflow: from provisioning, authoring, staging and reviewing to publishing

trans-unit.source: Integrated localization service: get your content localized and published easily
trans-unit.target: Integrated localization service: get your content localized and published easily

trans-unit.source: Connected BI service, established feedback loop and customizable analytics from content creator to consumers
trans-unit.target: Connected BI service, established feedback loop and customizable analytics from content creator to consumers

trans-unit.source: Consistent SEO approach
trans-unit.target: Consistent SEO approach

trans-unit.source: 3. Service Architecture
trans-unit.target: 3. Service Architecture

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Service Architecture</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Service Architecture</linkText>
